page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT IN PEBMARSH
page.content: With the increased mechanisation of farming,less and less people are employed by local farmers.The largest farmer in the area,Mr.J.Nott,employs only 5 men compared with over 20 men thirty years ago. The local workforce has been less affected by unemployment than have workers in other parts of the country,although some men employed in light industry in local towns have been made redundant. Villagers employed in offices,shops and light industry travel to local towns for their work.A small number commute to London. The area has become more middle-class and less working-class with a more affluent workforce being able to afford to travel further afield to reach their place of work.
